text: Anthurium cutucuense is a species of plant in the arum family, Araceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it is known from only two locations in Morona- Santiago and Zamora-Chinchipe Provinces. It is an epiphyte which grows in the forests of the lower Andes.Benavides, G. & Pitman, N. 2003. Anthurium cutucuense. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2015.2. Downloaded on 07 September 2015. ==References== cutucuense Category:Endangered plants Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Anthurium cutucuense
